subs.text: So at the beginning of this year, with the 20th anniversary of RSS 2.0 coming up, I asked myself a question -- why aren't you working on RSS?
And the answer is because there are a lot of mean people who gather around things like RSS, and they get personal and in your face, and make it impossible for people to do collaborative work.
And things like RSS only work with collaboration.
I decided that's a pretty stupid reason to not work on one of the most successful projects of my career, to let it just sit there and get weaker and more broken every year.
The theory was if I stepped up and moved the ideas of RSS forward, I'd get punished, but I wondered what if that didn't happen?
I'm just not going to stand for it. The moment a collaboration channel gets spammed by people who want to stop work, we're going say goodbye to them. Without a second thought. Enough bullshit.
